channel.title: How do I restore the recycle bin?
channel.description: Well I stupidly let my retarded mom use the computer which was a big mistake, she actually found a way to delete the recycle bin...Any one know how to restore this without using a system restore?

item.title: How do I restore the recycle bin?
item.dc:creator: @Thabest Thabest
item.description:
@Thabest wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:3, topic:113506”][quote author=http://www.usenet.com/newsgroups/comp.bugs.misc/msg00067.html]
You can get your Recycle Bin back by creating a new folder. Then,
rename it “Recycle.{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E}”. Name the
folder exactly as it appears between the quotes. The name before the
period can be any name but the part after the period must be exactly
the same. After the period is the CLSID identifier that Windows uses
to identify the Recycle Bin.
I’m pretty sure that this is the same CLSID for all of Microsoft’s
versions of Windows. If it doesn’t work for your version, do a
registry “Value” search for “Recycle Bin”. The Key Name for that value
is the CLSID for the Recycle Bin that you need to enter as part of the
folder’s name, instead of the one above.
[/quote]

Don’t ya love http://google.com?[/quote]

Thanks, this worked!

Read full topic
item.source: How do I restore the recycle bin?

item.title: How do I restore the recycle bin?
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Start -> Run -> Recycle Bin.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I restore the recycle bin?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

You can’t delete it, she must’ve hid it somewhere but I can’t remember now how to get it back. I read about it a while ago somewhere, something to do with registry editor.
